thread.title: ‘Jane by Design’ more than a ‘Prada’ knockoff
thread.title_full: ‘Jane by Design’ more than a ‘Prada’ knockoff - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: ‘Jane by Design’ more than a ‘Prada’ knockoff
text:
Rick Rowell/ABC Family Executive producer Gavin Polone, Andie MacDowell (c.) and Erica Dasher meet the press at a presentation for ‘Jane by Design.’ PASADENA — The new ABC Family drama “Jane by Design” follows a hard-working, naive young girl who goes to work for a ruthless, hard-driving fashion executive and slowly learns to play the game.
Andie MacDowell , who plays the executive, says please don’t compare it to “The Devil Wears Prada,” in which Meryl Streep played a ruthless, hard-driving fashion executive.
“There are some slight similarities,” MacDowell told TV critics here. “But they’re not really the same thing. In television, you get to know people on a different level because you have so much time.”
Erica Dasher , who plays the girl, said she and her friends have seen “Prada” multiple times, and calls the characters “much fuller” in “Jane by Design.”
n Now this is getting into character: Jorge Garcia , who is reunited with “Lost” creator J.J. Abrams on Fox’s “Alcatraz,” has not only taken the tour of the shuttered prison but recorded his own audio tour.
His character in “Alcatraz” plays a professor and Alcatraz expert/author who is drafted into an investigation when mysterious bad things start happening.
n Cee Lo Green , one of the judges/mentors on NBC’s “The Voice,” says TV talent shows may be one of the last places where artists are actually nurtured.
“Artist development is null and void at most record labels today,” said Green. “This is a place where you can get it.”
